productText:
000
FXUS62 KTBW 271349
AFDTBW

Area Forecast Discussion
National Weather Service Tampa Bay Ruskin FL
949 AM EDT Fri Sep 27 2024

...New UPDATE, AVIATION, MARINE...

.UPDATE...
Issued at 948 AM EDT Fri Sep 27 2024

Tropical Storm Helene is currently located over northern Georgia and 
continues moving northward toward Tennessee. We will continue to see 
residual effects with isolated showers and storms through the day as 
well as some marine hazards over the eastern gulf waters and local 
beaches. Will be removing the storm surge warnings for the Nature 
Coast and west central Florida later this morning. No other 
significant changes needed to forecast at this time. 

&&

.AVIATION...
(12Z TAFS)
Issued at 948 AM EDT Fri Sep 27 2024

Mostly VFR conditions will prevail at all terminals this morning. 
Conditions will continue to improve this morning as Helene moves 
further north away from the area, but scattered convection will 
continue to be possible at the southwest Florida TAF sites of PGD, 
FMY, and RSW. Gusty southwest winds at 10 to 15 knots with gusts to 
25 knots continue through the afternoon, then decreasing less than 
10 knots by the evening.

&&

.MARINE...
Issued at 948 AM EDT Fri Sep 27 2024

Hazardous marine conditions continue across the eastern gulf waters 
this morning with gusty SW winds around 20-25 knots and seas around 
8-12 feet. Will continue the Small Craft Advisory through early 
Saturday morning, then decreasing below Advisory level for the 
remainder of the weekend. Boaters should still exercise caution as 
residual seas will be slower to abate below 7 feet. Improving 
conditions continue into the beginning of the week with more 
favorable boating conditions likely into next week.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
TPA  89  79  88  78 /  10  10  50  40 
FMY  90  80  90  79 /  50  60  80  40

BKV  89  74  90  74 /  10  10  40  30

&&

     Hillsborough-Coastal Levy-Coastal Manatee-Coastal Pasco-
     Pinellas.

     Harbor and Pine Island Sound-Coastal waters from Bonita 
     Beach to Englewood FL out 20 NM-Coastal waters from 
     Englewood to Tarpon Springs FL out 20 NM-Coastal waters 
     from Tarpon Springs to Suwannee River FL out 20 NM-Tampa 
     Bay waters-Waters from Bonita Beach to Englewood FL out 20 
     to 60 NM-Waters from Englewood to Tarpon Springs FL out 20 
     to 60 NM-Waters from Tarpon Springs to Suwannee River FL 
     out 20 to 60 NM.


&&
